Yes, there are several other performance-based structures besides ESOPs. Some of these include:

1. Management Incentive Plans (MIPs) - This structure is designed to incentivize key managers and executives to achieve specific performance targets.
2. Performance-Based Stock Options - This structure provides employees with the opportunity to earn stock options based on their performance.
3. Performance-Based Bonuses - This structure provides employees with bonuses based on their performance.
4. Phantom Stock Plans - This structure allows employees to receive benefits similar to those of a stock option plan, but without actually owning stock.
5. Restricted Stock Units (RSUs) - This structure provides employees with restricted stock units that vest over time based on specific performance criteria.
6. Gain Sharing Programs - This structure rewards employees based on the overall performance of the company or a specific business unit.
7. Stock Appreciation Rights (SARs) - This structure allows employees to receive the appreciation in the value of a stock without actually owning the stock.
